argument.description: The number to test for its sign.

returnType: If number < 0, then the SIGN function returns -1. If number = 0, then the SIGN function returns 0. If number > 0, then the SIGN function returns 1.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL SIGN function returns a value indicating the sign of a number.
sample:
SIGN(-23)
Result: -1

SIGN(-0.001)
Result: -1

SIGN(0)
Result: 0

SIGN(0.001)
Result: 1

SIGN(23)
Result: 1

SIGN(23.601)
Result: 1
